title: The 13
text: • 954 – The 13-year-old Lothair III is crowned at the Abbey of Saint-Remi as king of the West Frankish Kingdom.

title: Future Byzantine empress Zoe takes the throne as empress consort to Romanos III Argyros.
text: • 1028 – Future Byzantine empress Zoe takes the throne as empress consort to Romanos III Argyros.

title: Battle of Posada: Wallachian Voievode Basarab I defeats the Hungarian army by ambush.
text: • 1330 – Battle of Posada: Wallachian Voievode Basarab I defeats the Hungarian army by ambush.

title: Plymouth becomes the first town incorporated by the English Parliament.
text: • 1439 – Plymouth becomes the first town incorporated by the English Parliament.

title: The Second Statute of Repeal re
text: • 1555 – The Second Statute of Repeal re-establishes Roman Catholicism in England under Queen Mary I.

title: Jean Sylvain Bailly, the first Mayor of Paris, is guillotined.
text: • 1793 – Jean Sylvain Bailly, the first Mayor of Paris, is guillotined.

title: William Heffelfinger becomes the first professional American football player on record, participating in his first paid game for the Allegheny Athletic Association.
text: • 1892 – William Heffelfinger becomes the first professional American football player on record, participating in his first paid game for the Allegheny Athletic Association.

title: Abdur Rahman Khan accepts the Durand Line as the border between Afghanistan and the British Raj.
text: • 1893 – Abdur Rahman Khan accepts the Durand Line as the border between Afghanistan and the British Raj.

title: Norway holds a referendum resulting in popular approval of the Storting's decision to authorise the government to make the offer of the throne of the newly
text: • 1905 – Norway holds a referendum resulting in popular approval of the Storting's decision to authorise the government to make the offer of the throne of the newly-independent country.

title: King George I of Greece makes a triumphal entry into Thessaloniki after its liberation from 482 years of Ottoman rule.
text: • 1912 – King George I of Greece makes a triumphal entry into Thessaloniki after its liberation from 482 years of Ottoman rule.

title: The frozen bodies of Robert Scott and his men are found on the Ross Ice Shelf in Antarctica.
text: • 1912 – The frozen bodies of Robert Scott and his men are found on the Ross Ice Shelf in Antarctica.

title: Austria becomes a republic.
text: • 1918 – Austria becomes a republic.

title: Italy and the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes sign the Treaty of Rapallo.
text: • 1920 – Italy and the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes sign the Treaty of Rapallo.

title: Leon Trotsky is expelled from the Soviet Communist Party, leaving Joseph Stalin in undisputed control of the Soviet Union.
text: • 1927 – Leon Trotsky is expelled from the Soviet Communist Party, leaving Joseph Stalin in undisputed control of the Soviet Union.

title: SS Vestris sinks approximately 200 miles (320 km) off Hampton Roads, Virginia, killing at least 110 passengers, mostly women and children who die after the vessel is abandoned.
text: • 1928 – SS Vestris sinks approximately 200 miles (320 km) off Hampton Roads, Virginia, killing at least 110 passengers, mostly women and children who die after the vessel is abandoned.

title: In California, the San Francisco
text: • 1936 – In California, the San Francisco–Oakland Bay Bridge opens to traffic.

title: World War II: The Battle of Gabon ends as Free French Forces take Libreville, Gabon, and all of French Equatorial Africa from Vichy French forces.
text: • 1940 – World War II: The Battle of Gabon ends as Free French Forces take Libreville, Gabon, and all of French Equatorial Africa from Vichy French forces.

title: World War II: Soviet Foreign Minister Vyacheslav Molotov arrives in Berlin to discuss the possibility of the Soviet Union joining the Axis Powers.
text: • 1940 – World War II: Soviet Foreign Minister Vyacheslav Molotov arrives in Berlin to discuss the possibility of the Soviet Union joining the Axis Powers.

title: World War II: Temperatures around Moscow drop to
text: • 1941 – World War II: Temperatures around Moscow drop to -12 °C as the Soviet Union launches ski troops for the first time against the freezing German forces near the city.

title: World War II: The Soviet cruiser Chervona Ukraina is destroyed during the Battle of Sevastopol.
text: • 1941 – World War II: The Soviet cruiser Chervona Ukraina is destroyed during the Battle of Sevastopol.

title: World War II: Naval Battle of Guadalcanal between Japanese and American forces begins near Guadalcanal. The battle lasts for three days and ends with an American victory.
text: • 1942 – World War II: Naval Battle of Guadalcanal between Japanese and American forces begins near Guadalcanal. The battle lasts for three days and ends with an American victory.

title: World War II: The Royal Air Force launches 29 Avro Lancaster bombers, which sink the German battleship Tirpitz, with 12,000 lb Tallboy bombs off Tromsø, Norway.
text: • 1944 – World War II: The Royal Air Force launches 29 Avro Lancaster bombers, which sink the German battleship Tirpitz, with 12,000 lb Tallboy bombs off Tromsø, Norway.

title: In Tokyo, the International Military Tribunal for the Far East sentences seven Japanese military and government officials, including General Hideki Tojo, to death for their roles in World War II.
text: • 1948 – In Tokyo, the International Military Tribunal for the Far East sentences seven Japanese military and government officials, including General Hideki Tojo, to death for their roles in World War II.

title: Ellis Island ceased operations.
text: • 1954 – Ellis Island ceased operations.

title: Morocco, Sudan and Tunisia join the United Nations.
text: • 1956 – Morocco, Sudan and Tunisia join the United Nations.

title: In the midst of the Suez Crisis, Palestinian refugees are shot dead in Rafah by Israeli soldiers following the invasion of the Gaza Strip.
text: • 1956 – In the midst of the Suez Crisis, Palestinian refugees are shot dead in Rafah by Israeli soldiers following the invasion of the Gaza Strip.

title: A team of rock climbers led by Warren Harding completes the first ascent of The Nose on El Capitan in Yosemite Valley.
text: • 1958 – A team of rock climbers led by Warren Harding completes the first ascent of The Nose on El Capitan in Yosemite Valley.

title: Vietnam War: Independent investigative journalist Seymour Hersh breaks the story of the My Lai Massacre.
text: • 1969 – Vietnam War: Independent investigative journalist Seymour Hersh breaks the story of the My Lai Massacre.

title: The Oregon Highway Division attempts to destroy a rotting beached Sperm whale with explosives, leading to the now infamous "exploding whale" incident.
text: • 1970 – The Oregon Highway Division attempts to destroy a rotting beached Sperm whale with explosives, leading to the now infamous "exploding whale" incident.

title: The 1970 Bhola cyclone makes landfall on the coast of East Pakistan becoming the deadliest tropical cyclone in history.
text: • 1970 – The 1970 Bhola cyclone makes landfall on the coast of East Pakistan becoming the deadliest tropical cyclone in history.

title: Vietnam War: As part of Vietnamization, US President Richard Nixon sets February 1, 1972 as the deadline for the removal of another 45,000 American troops from Vietnam.
text: • 1971 – Vietnam War: As part of Vietnamization, US President Richard Nixon sets February 1, 1972 as the deadline for the removal of another 45,000 American troops from Vietnam.

title: The Comoros joins the United Nations.
text: • 1975 – The Comoros joins the United Nations.

title: France conducts the Oreste nuclear test as 14th in the group of 29, 1975
text: • 1977 – France conducts the Oreste nuclear test as 14th in the group of 29, 1975–78 French nuclear tests series.

title: Iran hostage crisis: In response to the hostage situation in Tehran, US President Jimmy Carter orders a halt to all petroleum imports into the United States from Iran.
text: • 1979 – Iran hostage crisis: In response to the hostage situation in Tehran, US President Jimmy Carter orders a halt to all petroleum imports into the United States from Iran.

title: The NASA space probe Voyager I makes its closest approach to Saturn and takes the first images of its rings.
text: • 1980 – The NASA space probe Voyager I makes its closest approach to Saturn and takes the first images of its rings.

title: Space Shuttle program: Mission STS
text: • 1981 – Space Shuttle program: Mission STS-2, utilizing the Space Shuttle Columbia, marks the first time a manned spacecraft is launched into space twice.

title: USSR: Yuri Andropov becomes the General Secretary of the Communist Party's Central Committee, succeeding Leonid I. Brezhnev.
text: • 1982 – USSR: Yuri Andropov becomes the General Secretary of the Communist Party's Central Committee, succeeding Leonid I. Brezhnev.

title: Crown Prince Akihito is formally installed as Emperor Akihito of Japan, becoming the 125th Japanese monarch.
text: • 1990 – Crown Prince Akihito is formally installed as Emperor Akihito of Japan, becoming the 125th Japanese monarch.

title: Tim Berners
text: • 1990 – Tim Berners-Lee publishes a formal proposal for the World Wide Web.

title: Santa Cruz massacre: Indonesian forces open fire on a crowd of student protesters in Dili, East Timor.
text: • 1991 – Santa Cruz massacre: Indonesian forces open fire on a crowd of student protesters in Dili, East Timor.

title: Erdut Agreement regarding the peaceful resolution to the Croatian War of Independence was reached.
text: • 1995 – Erdut Agreement regarding the peaceful resolution to the Croatian War of Independence was reached.

title: A Saudi Arabian Airlines Boeing 747 and a Kazakh Ilyushin Il
text: • 1996 – A Saudi Arabian Airlines Boeing 747 and a Kazakh Ilyushin Il-76 cargo plane collide in mid-air near New Delhi, killing 349. The deadliest mid-air collision to date.

title: Ramzi Yousef is found guilty of masterminding the 1993 World Trade Center bombing.
text: • 1997 – Ramzi Yousef is found guilty of masterminding the 1993 World Trade Center bombing.

title: The 7.2 Mw Düzce earthquake shakes northwestern Turkey with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent). At least 845 people were killed and almost 5,000 were injured.
text: • 1999 – The 7.2 Mw Düzce earthquake shakes northwestern Turkey with a maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent). At least 845 people were killed and almost 5,000 were injured.

title: In New York City, American Airlines Flight 587, an Airbus A300 en route to the Dominican Republic, crashes minutes after takeoff from John F. Kennedy International Airport, killing all 260 on board and five on the ground.
text: • 2001 – In New York City, American Airlines Flight 587, an Airbus A300 en route to the Dominican Republic, crashes minutes after takeoff from John F. Kennedy International Airport, killing all 260 on board and five on the ground.

title: War in Afghanistan: Taliban forces abandon Kabul, ahead of advancing Afghan Northern Alliance troops.
text: • 2001 – War in Afghanistan: Taliban forces abandon Kabul, ahead of advancing Afghan Northern Alliance troops.

title: Iraq War: In Nasiriyah, Iraq, at least 23 people, among them the first Italian casualties of the 2003 invasion of Iraq, are killed in a suicide bomb attack on an Italian police base.
text: • 2003 – Iraq War: In Nasiriyah, Iraq, at least 23 people, among them the first Italian casualties of the 2003 invasion of Iraq, are killed in a suicide bomb attack on an Italian police base.

title: Shanghai Transrapid sets a new world speed record (501 kilometres per hour (311 mph)) for commercial railway systems, which remains the fastest for unmodified commercial rail vehicles.
text: • 2003 – Shanghai Transrapid sets a new world speed record (501 kilometres per hour (311 mph)) for commercial railway systems, which remains the fastest for unmodified commercial rail vehicles.

title: Silvio Berlusconi tenders his resignation as Prime Minister of Italy, effective November 16, due in large part to the European sovereign debt crisis.
text: • 2011 – Silvio Berlusconi tenders his resignation as Prime Minister of Italy, effective November 16, due in large part to the European sovereign debt crisis.

title: A blast in Iran's Shahid Modarres missile base leads to the death of 17 of the Revolutionary Guards members, including Hassan Tehrani Moghaddam, a key figure in Iran's missile program.
text: • 2011 – A blast in Iran's Shahid Modarres missile base leads to the death of 17 of the Revolutionary Guards members, including Hassan Tehrani Moghaddam, a key figure in Iran's missile program.

title: The Philae lander, deployed from the European Space Agency's Rosetta probe, reaches the surface of Comet 67P/Churyumov
text: • 2014 – The Philae lander, deployed from the European Space Agency's Rosetta probe, reaches the surface of Comet 67P/Churyumov–Gerasimenko.

title: Two suicide bombers detonated explosives in Bourj el
text: • 2015 – Two suicide bombers detonated explosives in Bourj el-Barajneh, Beirut, killing 43 people and injuring over 200 others.

title: The 7.3 Mw Kermanshah earthquake shakes the northern Iran
text: • 2017 – The 7.3 Mw Kermanshah earthquake shakes the northern Iran–Iraq border with a maximum Mercalli intensity of VIII (Severe). At least 410 people were killed and over 7,000 were injured.
